2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		Modulate_Avail.c				     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description: 	This module command prints out the modulefiles that  **
14   |  **			are available in the directories listed in the	     **
15   |  **			MODULEPATH environment variable.		     **
16   |  ** 									     **
17   |  **   Exports:		ModuleCmd_Avail					     **
18   |  **			print_aligned_files				     **
19   |  **			check_dir					     **
20   |  **			get_dir						     **
21   |  **			dirlst_to_list					     **
22   |  **			delete_dirlst					     **
23   |  **			delete_cache_list				     **
24   |  ** 									     **
25   |  **   Notes:								     **
26   |  ** 									     **
27   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
28   |  ****/
29   |

32   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
33   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
34   |  ** 									     ** 
35   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/

51   | /**
52   |  **  Structure for a linked list that stores directories to be listed.
53   |  **/
54   | 
55   | typedef struct _subdir_node {
56   |   fi_ent*              sd_dir;
57   |   struct _subdir_node* sd_next;
58   | } sd_node;
59   |

65   |  **  I tried having a test for isgraph() in the configuration file,
66   |  **  but it fails on AIX. This is the best I could come up with...
67   |  **/
68   | 
69   | #if !defined(isgraph) && defined(_P) && defined(_N)
70   | #  define isgraph(c)	((_ctype_+1)[c]&(_P|_U|_L|_N))
71   | #endif

73   | #define DIREST  50

86   | static	char	 buf[ LINELENGTH];
87   | static	char	 module_name[] = __FILE__;

90   | static	char	_proc_ModuleCmd_Avail[] = "ModuleCmd_Avail";
91   | #endif
92   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
93   | static	char	_proc_print_dir[] = "print_dir";
94   | static	char	_proc_print_aligned_files[] = "print_aligned_files";
95   | #endif
96   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
97   | static	char	_proc_check_dir[] = "check_dir";
98   | static	char	_proc_get_dir[] = "get_dir";
99   | static	char	_proc_dirlst_to_list[] = "dirlst_to_list";
100  | static	char	_proc_delete_dirlst[] = "delete_dirlst";
101  | static	char	_proc_delete_cache_list[] = "delete_cache_list";
102  | static	char	_proc_print_spaced_file[] = "print_spaced_file";
103  | static	char	_proc_mkdirnm[] = "mkdirnm";
104  | #endif

108  | #endif

111  | static	char	short_format_part[] = "%s/%s";
112  | static	char	short_format_full[] = "%s/%s(%s)";
113  | static	char	long_format[] = "%-39.39s  %-10.10s  %17s\n";
114  |  	char	long_header[] = "\
115  | - Package -----------------------------+- Versions -+- Last mod. ------\n";

123  | static	char	**_file_list_ptr = (char **) NULL;

126  | static	int	  _file_list_rd_ndx = 0;

133  | static	void	  print_spaced_file( char*, int, int, int);
134  | static	char	 *mkdirnm( char*, char*);
135  | static	int	  fi_ent_cmp( const void*, const void*);
136  | static	void	  _init_file_list(void);

143  | /*++++
144  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
145  |  ** 									     **
146  |  **   Function:		ModuleCmd_Avail					     **
147  |  ** 									     **
148  |  **   Description:	Execution of the 'module avail' command		     **
149  |  ** 									     **
150  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
151  |  ** 									     **
152  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Current Tcl Interpr. **
153  |  **			char		*argv[]		Arguments to the     **
154  |  **							command		     **
155  |  ** 									     **
156  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
157  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any failure		     **
158  |  ** 									     **
159  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_specified_module	The module name from the     **
160  |  **						command line.		     **
161  |  ** 									     **
162  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
163  |  ++++*/
164  | 
165  | int ModuleCmd_Avail(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
166  | 			int		 argc,
167  |                 	char		*argv[])
168  | {
169  |     char	*dirname;
170  |     char	*modpath;
171  |     int		 Result = -TCL_ERROR;
172  |     
173  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
174  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_ModuleCmd_Avail, NULL);
175  | #endif
176  | 
177  |     /**
178  |      **  If there's no MODULEPATH defined, we cannot output anything
179  |      **  We perform 1 level of env.var. expansion
180  |      **/
181  | 
182  |     if( !(modpath = (char *) xgetenv( "MODULEPATH")))
183  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_MODULE_PATH, LOC, NULL))
184  | 	    goto unwind0;
185  |  
186  |     /**
187  |      **  If we're given a full-path, then we'll just check that directory.
188  |      **  Otherwise, we'll check every directory in MODULESPATH.
189  |      **/
190  | 
191  |     if( argc > 0 && **argv == '/') {
192  | 
193  | 	while( argc--) {
194  | 
195  | 	    /**
196  | 	     ** Set the name of the module specified on the command line
197  | 	     **/
198  | 
199  | 	    g_specified_module = *argv;
200  | 
201  | 	    if( !check_dir( *argv)) {
202  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_PARAM, LOC, NULL)) {
203  | 		    Result = TCL_ERROR;	/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (FAILURE) --> **/
204  | 		}
205  | 	    } else {
206  | 		print_dir( interp, *argv, NULL);
207  | 	    }
208  | 	    argv++;
209  | 	}
210  | 
211  |     } else {
212  | 
213  | 	/**
214  | 	 **  We're not given a full path. Tokenize the module path string and
215  | 	 **  print the contents of each directory specified (if it exists ;-)
216  | 	 **/
217  | 
218  | 	if( sw_format & SW_LONG)
219  | 	    fprintf( stderr, _(long_header));
220  | 
221  | 	/**
222  | 	 **  If a module category is specified check whether it is part
223  | 	 **  of the directory we're scanning at the moment.
224  | 	 **/
225  | 
226  | 	if( argc > 0) {  /* show sub directory */
227  | 	    while( argc--) {
228  | 		/**
229  | 		 ** Set the name of the module specified on the command line
230  | 		 **/
231  | 
232  | 		g_specified_module = *argv;
233  | 
234  | 		dirname = modpath;
235  | 		while( dirname && *dirname) {
236  | 
237  | 		    /**
238  | 		     **  We cannot use strtok here, because it interfers with
239  | 		     **  subsequent calls while printing the list
240  | 		     **/
241  | 
242  | 		    char *s;
243  | 		
244  | 		    if( (s = strchr( dirname, ':')) )
245  | 			*s++ = '\0';
246  | 
247  | 		    /**
248  | 		     **  Print the cathegory
249  | 		     **/
250  | 
251  | 		    if( check_dir( dirname))
252  | 			print_dir( interp, dirname, *argv);
253  | 		    dirname = s;
254  | 		}
255  | 
256  | 		argv++;
257  | 	    }
258  | 
259  | 	/**
260  | 	 **  Otherwise, if there's no category given, descend the current
261  | 	 **  directory and print its contents.
262  | 	 **/
263  | 
264  | 	} else {
265  | 
266  | 	    dirname = modpath;
267  | 	    while( dirname && *dirname) {
268  | 
269  | 		/**
270  | 		 **  We cannot use strtok here, because it interfers with
271  | 		 **  subsequent calls while printing the list
272  | 		 **/
273  | 
274  | 		char *s;
275  | 	    
276  | 		if( (s = strchr( dirname, ':')) )
277  | 		    *s++ = '\0';
278  | 
279  | 		/**
280  | 		 **  Second part of tokenization
281  | 		 **/
282  | 
283  | 		if( check_dir( dirname))
284  | 		    print_dir( interp, dirname, NULL);
285  | 		dirname = s;
286  | 	    }
287  | 
288  |         } /** for **/
289  |     } /** if( no full path name given) **/
290  | 
291  |     /**
292  |      **  Free up what has been allocated and exit from this procedure
293  |      **/
294  |     /* if got here via this path ... it must have been OK */
295  |     if(Result < 0) Result = TCL_OK;
296  | 
297  | unwind1:
298  |     null_free((void *) &modpath);
299  | 
300  | unwind0:
301  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
302  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_ModuleCmd_Avail, NULL);
303  | #endif
304  | 
305  |     /* if Result is negative here ... must have been an unwind */
306  |     if (Result < 0) Result = -Result;
307  | 
308  |     return( Result);		/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (FAILURE/SUCCESS) --> **/
309  | 
310  | } /** End of 'ModuleCmd_Avail' **/
311  | 
312  | /*++++
313  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
314  |  ** 									     **
315  |  **   Function:		check_dir					     **
316  |  ** 									     **
317  |  **   Description:	Open and close the passed directory in order to check**
318  |  **			if it does exist and is readable		     **
319  |  ** 									     **
320  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
321  |  ** 									     **
322  |  **   Parameters:	char	*dirname	Name of the directory to be  **
323  |  **						checked			     **
324  |  ** 									     **
325  |  **   Result:		int	0	Not a directory or unreadable	     **
326  |  **				1	OK				     **
327  |  ** 									     **
328  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
329  |  ** 									     **
330  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
331  |  ++++*/
332  | 
333  | int check_dir(	char	*dirname)
334  | {
335  |     DIR*   dirp;
336  | 
337  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
338  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_check_dir, NULL);
339  | #endif
340  | 
341  |     if( !(dirp = opendir( dirname))) 
342  | 	return( 0);
343  | 
344  |     if( -1 == closedir( dirp))
345  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSEDIR, LOC, dirname, NULL))
346  | 	    return( 0);
347  | 
348  |     return( 1);
349  | 
350  | } /** End of 'check_dir' **/
351  | 
352  | /*++++
353  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
354  |  ** 									     **
355  |  **   Function:		print_dir					     **
356  |  ** 									     **
357  |  **   Description:	Print all files beyond the passed directory	     **
358  |  ** 									     **
359  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
360  |  ** 									     **
361  |  **   Parameters:	char	*dir		Directory to be scanned	     **
362  |  **			char	*module		A selcted module name or NULL**
363  |  ** 									     **
364  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
365  |  ** 									     **
366  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
367  |  ** 									     **
368  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
369  |  ++++*/
370  | 
371  | static	int	print_dir(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
372  | 				char		*dir,
373  | 				char		*module)
374  | {
375  |     fi_ent	 *dirlst_head = NULL;	/** Directory list base pointer	     **/
376  |     int		  count = 0;		/** Number of elements in the top    **/
377  | 					/** level directory list	     **/
378  |     int		  tcount = 0;		/** Total number of files to print   **/
379  |     int	 	  start = 0;
380  |     int		  dirlen;
381  |     char	**cache_list = NULL;
382  |     char	 *selection, *s;
383  | 
384  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
385  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_print_dir, "dir='", dir, NULL);
386  | #endif
387  | 
388  |     /**
389  |      **  Print the directory name
390  |      **/
391  | 
392  |     if( (sw_format & (SW_PARSE | SW_TERSE | SW_LONG))
393  |     && !(sw_format & (SW_HUMAN | SW_LIST)) ) {
394  | 	/* char *base = strrchr( dir, '/');
395  | 	fprintf( stderr, "%s:\n", base ? ++base : dir);
396  | 	*/
397  | 	fprintf( stderr, "%s:\n", dir);
398  |     }
399  | 
400  |     if( dir)
401  | 	dirlen = strlen( dir) + 1;
402  |     else
403  | 	dirlen = 0;
404  | 
405  |     /**
406  |      **  If the is a module selection given, build the whole selected path
407  |      **/
408  | 
409  |     if( module) {
410  | 
411  | 	if( dir) {
412  | 	    if((char *) NULL == (selection = stringer(NULL, 0,
413  | 		dir,"/",module, NULL))) {
414  | 		ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
415  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);     /** --- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
416  | 	    }
417  | 
418  | 	} else
419  | 	    selection = module;
420  | 
421  |     } else
422  | 	selection = (char *) NULL;
423  | 
424  |     if( !cache_list) {
425  | 
426  | 	/**
427  | 	 **  Normal reading of the files
428  | 	 **/
429  | 
430  | 	if( NULL == (dirlst_head = get_dir( dir, NULL, &count, &tcount)))
431  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_READDIR, LOC, dir, NULL))
432  | 		goto unwind1;
433  | 
434  | 	if( NULL ==
435  | 		(cache_list = (char**) module_malloc(tcount * sizeof(char**))))
436  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
437  | 		goto unwind1;
438  | 	(void) memset(cache_list, 0, tcount * sizeof( char **));
439  | 
440  | 	start=0;
441  | 	dirlst_to_list( cache_list, dirlst_head, count, &start, dir, selection);
442  | 
443  |     }
444  | 
445  |     /**
446  |      **  In case of any selection, we have to force all .modulrc's and .versions
447  |      **  on the path
448  |      **/
449  | 
450  |     if( dir) {
451  | 
452  | 	s = dir;
453  | 	while( s) {
454  | 	    if( (s = strchr( s, '/')) )
455  | 	    	*s = '\0';
456  | 	    else
457  | 		break;
458  | 
459  | 	    SourceRC( interp, dir, modulerc_file);
460  | 	    SourceVers( interp, dir, module);
461  | 
462  | 	    if( s)
463  | 		*s++ = '/';
464  | 	}
465  | 
466  | 	/**
467  | 	 **  Finally source the rc files in the directory itself
468  | 	 **/
469  | 
470  | 	SourceRC( interp, dir, modulerc_file);
471  | 	SourceVers( interp, dir, module);
472  |     }
473  | 
474  |     if( dir && selection)
475  | 	null_free((void *) &selection);
476  | 
477  |     /**
478  |      **  Print and remove the cache list
479  |      **/
480  | 
481  |     delete_dirlst( dirlst_head, count);
482  |     print_aligned_files( interp, dir, dir, cache_list, tcount,
483  | 	(sw_format & SW_LIST ? 1 : -1));
484  |     delete_cache_list( cache_list, start);
485  | 
486  |     if( sw_format & SW_LONG)
487  | 	fprintf( stderr, "\n");
488  |     return( TCL_OK);     		/** ------- EXIT (SUCCESS) --------> **/
489  | 
490  | unwind1:
491  |     if( dir && selection)
492  | 	null_free((void *) &selection);
493  | 
494  | unwind0:
495  |     return( TCL_ERROR);     		/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
496  | 
497  | } /** End of 'print_dir' **/
498  | 
499  | /*++++
500  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
501  |  ** 									     **
502  |  **   Function:		get_dir						     **
503  |  ** 									     **
504  |  **   Description:	Read in the passed directory and save every interes- **
505  |  **			ting item in the directory list			     **
506  |  **			skipping known version control directories:	     **
507  |  **				CVS RCS .git .svn			     **
508  |  **			unless they contain .version files		     **
509  |  ** 									     **
510  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
511  |  ** 									     **
512  |  **   Parameters:	char	*dir		Directory to be read	     **
513  |  **			char	*prefix		Directory prefix (path)	     **
514  |  **			int	*listcount	Buffer to store the number of**
515  |  **						elements in the current      **
516  |  **						directory list		     **
517  |  **			int 	*total_count	Buffer for the total number  **
518  |  **						of files read		     **
519  |  ** 									     **
520  |  **   Result:		fi_ent*		NULL	Failure			     **
521  |  **					else	Directory list base pointer  **
522  |  **			*listcount		Number of elements in the    **
523  |  **						top level directory list     **
524  |  **			*total_count		Total number of files read   **
525  |  ** 									     **
526  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
527  |  ** 									     **
528  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
529  |  ++++*/
530  | 
531  | fi_ent	*get_dir(	char	*dir,
532  | 			char	*prefix,
533  | 			int	*listcount,
534  | 			int	*total_count)
535  | {
536  |     struct dirent	*dp;		/** Directory read pointer	     **/
537  |     DIR			*dirptr;	/** Directory handle		     **/
538  |     fi_ent		*dirlst_head,	/** Directory list pointers. Head,   **/
539  |     			*dirlst_cur,	/** current			     **/
540  |     			*dirlst_last;	/** and last			     **/
541  |     char		*dirname;	/** Expanded directory path name     **/
542  |     char		*tmp;		
543  |     int			 count = 0;
544  | 
545  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
546  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_get_dir, NULL);
547  | #endif
548  | 
549  |     /**
550  |      **  Open the desired directiory
551  |      **/
552  | 
553  |     if( !(dirptr = opendir( dir))) {
554  | #if 0
555  | 	/* if you can't open a directory ... is that really an error? */
556  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_OPENDIR, LOC, dir, NULL))
557  | #endif
558  | 	    return( NULL);	/** ----------- EXIT (FAILURE) ------------> **/
559  |     }
560  | 
561  |     /**
562  |      **  Allocate memory for reading in the directory
563  |      **/
564  | 
565  |     if( NULL == (dirlst_cur = dirlst_head = (fi_ent*) calloc( DIREST,
566  | 	sizeof( fi_ent)))) {
567  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL)) {
568  | 	    if( -1 == closedir( dirptr))
569  | 		ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSEDIR, LOC, dir, NULL);
570  | 	    goto unwind0;
571  | 	}
572  |     }
573  |     dirlst_last = dirlst_head + DIREST;
574  |   
575  |     /**
576  |      **  Read in the  contents of the directory. Ignore dotfiles
577  |      **		and version directories.
578  |      **/
579  | 
580  |     for( count = 0,  dp = readdir( dirptr); dp != NULL; dp = readdir( dirptr)) {
581  |         if( *dp->d_name == '.') continue;
582  | 
583  | 	/**
584  | 	 **  Conditionally double up the space allocated for reading the direc-
585  | 	 **  tory
586  | 	 **/
587  | 
588  |         if(dirlst_cur == dirlst_last) {
589  |             if( NULL == (dirlst_head = (fi_ent*) realloc( (char*) dirlst_head, 
590  | 		(count<<1) * sizeof( fi_ent)))) 
591  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL)) 
592  | 		    goto unwind0;
593  |             dirlst_cur = dirlst_head + count;
594  |             dirlst_last = dirlst_head + (count<<1);
595  | 	}
596  | 
597  | 	/**
598  | 	 **  Build the complete path name and get information about the file
599  | 	 **/
600  | 
601  |         if( !( dirname = mkdirnm( dir, dp->d_name)))
602  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DIRNAME, LOC, NULL)) {
603  | 		if( -1 == closedir( dirptr))
604  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSEDIR, LOC, dir, NULL);
605  | 		goto unwind1;
606  | 	    }
607  | 
608  |         if( stat( dirname, &(dirlst_cur->fi_stats)) < 0)
609  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DIRNOTFOUND, LOC, dirname, NULL)) {
610  | 		if( -1 == closedir( dirptr))
611  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSEDIR, LOC, dir, NULL);
612  | 		goto unwind1;
613  | 	    }
614  | 
615  | 	/**
616  | 	 **  If it is a directory, recursively delve into it ..
617  | 	 **/
618  | 
619  |         if(dirlst_cur->fi_stats.st_mode & S_IFDIR) {
620  |             char* np;
621  |             char* ndir;
622  |             int   tmpcount = 0;
623  | 
624  | 	    /**
625  | 	     **  Build the new base points for the recursion
626  | 	     **/
627  | 
628  |             if( !( tmp = mkdirnm( prefix, dp->d_name))) {
629  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DIRNAME, LOC, NULL)) {
630  | 		    if( -1 == closedir( dirptr))
631  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSEDIR, LOC, dir, NULL);
632  | 		    goto unwind1;
633  | 		}
634  | 	    } else {
635  | 		if( NULL == (np = stringer(NULL,0, tmp, NULL)))
636  | 		    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
637  | 			goto unwind1;
638  | 	    }
639  | 
640  |             if( !( tmp = mkdirnm( dir, dp->d_name))) {
641  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DIRNAME, LOC, NULL)) {
642  | 		    if( -1 == closedir( dirptr))
643  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSEDIR, LOC, dir, NULL);
644  | 		    goto unwind1;
645  | 		}
646  | 	    } else {
647  | 		if( NULL == (ndir = stringer(NULL,0, tmp, NULL)))
648  | 		    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL)) 
649  | 			goto unwind1;
650  | 	    }
651  | 
652  | 	    /**
653  | 	     **  What if it's a known version control directory
654  | 	     **  check if it has a .version file
655  | 	     **/
656  | 	    if (!strcmp("CVS",dp->d_name)
657  | 	    ||  !strcmp("RCS",dp->d_name)
658  | 	    ||  !strcmp(".git",dp->d_name)
659  | 	    ||  !strcmp(".svn",dp->d_name)) {
660  |     		FILE	*fi;
661  | 		if( (char *) NULL == stringer(buffer, MOD_BUFSIZE,
662  | 		    tmp, "/.version", NULL))
663  | 		    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
664  | 			goto unwind1;
665  | 		if( NULL == (fi = fopen( buffer, "r"))) {
666  | 			/* does not have a .version file */
667  | 			continue;
668  | 		} else {
669  | 			/* has a .version file ... assume to be module dir */
670  | 			fclose(fi);
671  | 		}
672  | 	    }
673  | 
674  | 	    /**
675  | 	     **  The recursion itself ...
676  | 	     **/
677  | 
678  |             dirlst_cur->fi_subdir = get_dir( ndir,np,&dirlst_cur->fi_listcount,
679  | 		&tmpcount);
680  | 
681  |             /**
682  |              **  Add the number of real modulefiles (i.e. not subdirs and 
683  |              **  not non-modulefiles) to our total number of modulefiles 
684  |              **  contained in the structure.
685  |              **/
686  | 
687  |             *total_count += tmpcount;
688  | 
689  |             /**
690  |              **  This means that it's an empty directory so the prefix is
691  | 	     **  never used
692  |              **/
693  | 
694  |             if( !dirlst_cur->fi_listcount)
695  | 		null_free((void *) &np);
696  |             null_free((void *) &ndir);
697  | 
698  | 	/**
699  | 	 **  if it is not a directory check the magic cookie of the file. Only
700  | 	 **  files with the modules magic cookie will be accepted. Also tem-
701  | 	 **  porary files are to be ignored.
702  | 	 **/
703  | 
704  |         } else if( dp->d_name[NLENGTH(dp)-1] == '~' ||
705  | 	    !check_magic( dirname, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE,
706  | 		MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) {
707  | 	    continue;
708  | 	} else {
709  | 	    dirlst_cur->fi_subdir = NULL;
710  | 	}
711  | 
712  | 	/**
713  | 	 **  Put the name of the file on the directory list
714  | 	 **/
715  | 
716  | 	dirlst_cur->fi_prefix = prefix;
717  | 	if( NULL == (dirlst_cur->fi_name = stringer(NULL,0, dp->d_name, NULL)))
718  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL)) 
719  | 		goto unwind1;
720  | 
721  | 	/**
722  | 	 **  Count even the number of elements in the current list as the
723  | 	 **  total number of elements read in so far.
724  | 	 **  Increment the list index to be prepared for the next entry.
725  | 	 **/
726  | 
727  | 	count++;
728  | 	(*total_count)++;
729  | 	dirlst_cur++;
730  | 
731  |     } /** for **/
732  | 
733  |     /**
734  |      **  Now sort alphabetically what has been read
735  |      **/
736  | 
737  |     if( count > 1)
738  | 	qsort( dirlst_head, count, sizeof(fi_ent), fi_ent_cmp);
739  | 
740  |     /**
741  |      **  Close the directory, set up return values
742  |      **/
743  | 
744  |     if( -1 == closedir( dirptr))
745  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSEDIR, LOC, dir, NULL))
746  | 	    goto unwind1;
747  | 
748  |     *listcount = count;
749  |     return( dirlst_head); 	/** ----------- EXIT (SUCCESS) ------------> **/
750  | 
751  | unwind1:
752  |     null_free((void *) &dirlst_cur);
753  | 
754  | unwind0:
755  |     return( NULL);	 	/** ----------- EXIT (FAILURE) ------------> **/
756  | } /** End of 'get_dir' **/
757  | 
758  | /*++++
759  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
760  |  ** 									     **
761  |  **   Function:		dirlst_to_list					     **
762  |  ** 									     **
763  |  **   Description:	Transform the passed nested directory list into a    **
764  |  **			flat list of strings				     **
765  |  ** 									     **
766  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
767  |  ** 									     **
768  |  **   Parameters:	char	**list		List to be created	     **
769  |  **			fi_ent	 *dirlst_head	Head of the directory list   **
770  |  **						to be transformed	     **
771  |  **			int	  count		Number of elements in the    **
772  |  **						directory list		     **
773  |  **			int	 *beginning	Index of the element in List **
774  |  **						to start appending the file- **
775  |  **						names at.		     **
776  |  **			char	 *path		prepend pathname to list     **
777  |  **			char	 *module	A search pattern	     **
778  |  **									     **
779  |  **   Result:		-						     **
780  |  ** 									     **
781  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
782  |  ** 									     **
783  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
784  |  ++++*/
785  | 
786  | void	dirlst_to_list(	char	**list,
787  | 			fi_ent	 *dirlst_head,
788  | 			int	  count,
789  | 			int	 *beginning,
790  | 			char	 *path,
791  | 			char	 *module)
792  | {
793  |     fi_ent	*dirlst_cur;	
794  |     int 	 i;
795  |     char	*ptr;
796  |     int		 mlen;
797  | 
798  |     /**
799  |      **  If there's any selection given, figure out its length
800  |      **/
801  | 
802  |     if( module)
803  | 	mlen = strlen( module);
804  | 
805  |     /**
806  |      **  Put all files in the directory list at the end of the passed list
807  |      **  of character arrays
808  |      **/
809  | 
810  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
811  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_dirlst_to_list, NULL);
812  | #endif
813  | 
814  |     for( i=0, dirlst_cur=dirlst_head;
815  | 	 i<count && dirlst_cur;
816  |          i++, dirlst_cur++) {
817  | 
818  |         if( dirlst_cur->fi_prefix) {
819  | 
820  | 	    if( path) {
821  | 		if( (char *) NULL == stringer(buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,
822  | 		    path,"/", dirlst_cur->fi_prefix,"/", dirlst_cur->fi_name,
823  | 		    NULL))
824  | 			return;
825  | 	    } else {
826  | 		if( (char *) NULL == stringer(buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,
827  | 		    dirlst_cur->fi_prefix,"/", dirlst_cur->fi_name, NULL))
828  | 			return;
829  | 	    }
830  | 
831  | 	    ptr = buf;
832  |         } else {
833  | 	    if( path) {
834  | 		if( (char *) NULL == stringer(buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,
835  | 		    path,"/", dirlst_cur->fi_name, NULL))
836  | 			return;
837  | 		ptr = buf;
838  | 
839  | 	    } else
840  | 		ptr = dirlst_cur->fi_name;
841  |         }
842  | 
843  | 	/**
844  | 	 **  Check whether this is part of the selected modules ...
845  | 	 **/
846  | 
847  | 	if( !module || !strncmp( module, buf, mlen)) {
848  | 
849  | 	    /**
850  | 	     **  Put this guy on the list
851  | 	     **/
852  | 
853  | 	    if( NULL == (list[(*beginning)++] = stringer(NULL,0, ptr, NULL))) {
854  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL)) {
855  | 		    while( i--) 
856  | 			null_free((void *) list + (--(*beginning)));
857  | 		    return;		/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
858  | 		}
859  | 	    }
860  | 	}
861  | 
862  | 	/**
863  | 	 **  recursively descend to subdirectories
864  | 	 **/
865  | 
866  |         if( dirlst_cur->fi_subdir)
867  |             dirlst_to_list( list, dirlst_cur->fi_subdir,
868  | 		dirlst_cur->fi_listcount, beginning, path, module);
869  |     } /** for **/
870  | 
871  | } /** end of 'dirlst_to_list' **/
872  | 
873  | /*++++
874  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
875  |  ** 									     **
876  |  **   Function:		delete_dirlst					     **
877  |  ** 									     **
878  |  **   Description:	Delete an entire directory list including all sub-   **
879  |  **			directory lists					     **
880  |  ** 									     **
881  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
882  |  ** 									     **
883  |  **   Parameters:	fi_ent	*dirlst_head	Head of the list to be re-   **
884  |  **						moved			     **
885  |  ** 									     **
886  |  **   Result:		-						     **
887  |  ** 									     **
888  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
889  |  ** 									     **
890  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
891  |  ++++*/
892  | 
893  | void	delete_dirlst(	fi_ent	*dirlst_head,
894  | 			int	 count)
895  | {
896  |     fi_ent	*dirlst_cur;
897  |     int 	 i;
898  | 
899  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
900  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_delete_dirlst, NULL);
901  | #endif
902  | 
903  |     if( !dirlst_head)
904  | 	return;
905  | 
906  |     /**
907  |      **  Free all filenames stored in the list
908  |      **/
909  | 
910  |     for( i=0, dirlst_cur=dirlst_head;
911  | 	 i<count && dirlst_cur;
912  |          i++, dirlst_cur++) {
913  | 
914  |         null_free((void *) &(dirlst_cur->fi_name));
915  | 
916  | 	/**
917  | 	 **  Recursivle decend to subdirectories
918  | 	 **/
919  | 
920  |         if( dirlst_cur->fi_subdir) 
921  |             delete_dirlst( dirlst_cur->fi_subdir, dirlst_cur->fi_listcount);
922  |     } /** for **/
923  | 
924  |     /**
925  |      **  Remove the entire list
926  |      **/
927  | 
928  |     if( dirlst_head->fi_prefix)
929  | 	null_free((void *) &(dirlst_head->fi_prefix));
930  |     null_free((void *) &dirlst_head);
931  | 
932  | } /** End of 'delete_dirlst' **/
933  | 
934  | /*++++
935  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
936  |  ** 									     **
937  |  **   Function:		delete_cache_list				     **
938  |  ** 									     **
939  |  **   Description:	Remove an entire list of allocated strings and free  **
940  |  **			up the used memory				     **
941  |  ** 									     **
942  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
943  |  ** 									     **
944  |  **   Parameters:	char	**list		List of filenames to be print**
945  |  **			int	  tcount	Size ofd the list in elements**
946  |  ** 									     **
947  |  **   Result:		-						     **
948  |  ** 									     **
949  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
950  |  ** 									     **
951  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
952  |  ++++*/
953  | 
954  | void delete_cache_list(	char	**list,
955  | 			    int	  tcount)
956  | {
957  |     int i;
958  | 
959  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
960  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_delete_cache_list, NULL);
961  | #endif
962  | 
963  |     for( i=0; i<tcount; i++)
964  |         null_free((void *) (list + i));
965  |     
966  |     null_free((void *)&list);
967  | 
968  | } /** End of 'delete_cache_list' **/
969  | 
970  | /*++++
971  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
972  |  ** 									     **
973  |  **   Function:		print_aligned_files				     **
974  |  ** 									     **
975  |  **   Description:	Print out the filenames passed in a sorted array     **
976  |  **			column by column taking care of the order being re-  **
977  |  **			flected to the single columns			     **
978  |  ** 									     **
979  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
980  |  ** 									     **
981  |  **   Parameters:	char	**list		List of filenames to print   **
982  |  **			char	 *path		common path		     **
983  |  **			char	 *header	List header		     **
984  |  **			int	  tcount	Size of the list in elements **
985  |  **			int	  numbered	Controls printing of numbers **
986  |  ** 						set to -1 for none	     **
987  |  ** 									     **
988  |  **   Result:		-						     **
989  |  ** 									     **
990  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
991  |  **						by the current command	     **
992  |  ** 									     **
993  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
994  |  ++++*/
995  | 
996  | void print_aligned_files(	Tcl_Interp	 *interp,
997  | 				char		 *path,
998  | 				char		 *header,
999  | 				char		**list,
1000 | 				int		  tcount,
1001 | 				int		  numbered)
1002 | {
1003 |     struct stat	 stats;
1004 |     struct tm	*tm;
1005 |     char 	*symbols, *module, *release;
1006 |     char	 buffer[ 20];
1007 |     char	 modulefile[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
1008 |     char	 modulename[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
1009 |     char	*timestr;
1010 |     char	*s;
1011 |     int		 t;
1012 |     int		 terminal_width = 80;
1013 |     int 	 maxlen = 0;
1014 |     char	*modpath = NULL;
1015 | 
1016 | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
1017 |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_print_aligned_files, NULL);
1018 | #endif
1019 | 
1020 |     /**
1021 |      **  In case of terse, human output we need to obtain the size of 
1022 |      **  the tty
1023 |      **/ 
1024 | 
1025 |     if( sw_format & (SW_HUMAN | SW_LONG) ) {
1026 | 	struct winsize window_size;
1027 | 	int fd_err = fileno( stderr);
1028 | 
1029 | 	if( isatty( fd_err))
1030 | 	    if( ioctl( fd_err, TIOCGWINSZ, &window_size) != -1)
1031 | 		terminal_width = (window_size.ws_col == 0) ?
1032 | 		    80 : window_size.ws_col;
1033 |     }
1034 | 
1035 |     if (! path) {
1036 | 	modpath = (char *) xgetenv( "MODULEPATH");
1037 | 	if (! modpath) {
1038 | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_MODULE_PATH, LOC, NULL)) {
1039 | 		return;
1040 | 	    }
1041 | 	}
1042 |     }
1043 | 
1044 |     /**
1045 |      **  Scan all entries of the passed list
1046 |      **/
1047 | 
1048 |     _init_file_list();
1049 |     while( list && tcount-- && *list) {
1050 | 	/**
1051 | 	 ** find module[/version] in filename
1052 | 	 **/
1053 | 	if( (g_current_module = s = strrchr( *list, '/')) ) {
1054 | 		*s = 0;
1055 | 		g_current_module++;
1056 | 		if (TCL_ERROR == Locate_ModuleFile(interp, g_current_module,
1057 | 			modulename, modulefile)) {
1058 | 			g_current_module = strrchr(*list, '/');
1059 | 			g_current_module++;
1060 | 		}
1061 | 		*s = '/';
1062 | 	}
1063 | 	if( !stat( *list, &stats)) {
1064 | 
1065 | 	    /**
1066 | 	     **  If the file is a directory, try to source the .modulerc
1067 | 	     **  file and skip to the next file
1068 | 	     **/
1069 | 
1070 | 	    if( S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode)) {
1071 | 		SourceRC( interp, *list, modulerc_file);
1072 | 		SourceVers( interp, *list, g_current_module);
1073 | 		g_current_module = (char *) NULL;
1074 | 		list++;
1075 | 		continue;
1076 | 	    }
1077 | 
1078 | 	    /**
1079 | 	     **  get a copy of the current item to print in order not to
1080 | 	     **  change the function input
1081 | 	     **/
1082 | 
1083 | 	    if(path == (char *)NULL) {
1084 | 		int maxPrefixLength = 0;
1085 | 
1086 | 		if (modpath) {
1087 | 		    /**
1088 | 		     ** try to find the longest prefix from the module path
1089 | 		     ** Huge hack!
1090 | 		     **/
1091 | 
1092 | 		    int prefixLength;
1093 | 		    char *colon;
1094 | 		    char *prefix = modpath;
1095 | 
1096 | 		    while (prefix != (char *) NULL && *prefix != '\0') {
1097 | 			colon = strchr(prefix, ':');
1098 | 			prefixLength = colon == NULL ? strlen(prefix) :
1099 | 						       colon - prefix;
1100 | 			while (prefix[prefixLength - 1] == '/') {
1101 | 			    prefixLength -= 1;
1102 | 			}
1103 | 			if (prefixLength > maxPrefixLength &&
1104 | 			    ! strncmp(*list, prefix, prefixLength) &&
1105 | 			    (*list)[prefixLength] == '/')
1106 | 			{
1107 | 			    maxPrefixLength = prefixLength;
1108 | 			}
1109 | 
1110 | 			if (colon != NULL) {
1111 | 			    colon += 1;
1112 | 			}
1113 | 		        prefix = colon;
1114 | 		    }
1115 | 
1116 | 		    /**
1117 | 		     ** Skip over '/'
1118 | 		     **/
1119 | 		    if (maxPrefixLength > 0) {
1120 | 			maxPrefixLength += 1;
1121 | 		    }
1122 | 		}
1123 | 
1124 | 		module = stringer(NULL,0, *list + maxPrefixLength, NULL);
1125 | 	    } else {
1126 | 		t = strlen(path);
1127 | 		if (*(*list + t) == '/') t++;
1128 | 		module = stringer(NULL,0, *list + t, NULL);
1129 | 	    }
1130 | 	    if((char *) NULL == module) {
1131 | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
1132 | 		    break;
1133 | 		else
1134 | 		    continue;
1135 | 	    }
1136 | 
1137 | 	    /**
1138 | 	     **  Expand the symbols and get the version of the module
1139 | 	     **/
1140 | 
1141 | 	    if((char *) NULL == (symbols = ExpandVersions( module)))
1142 | 		symbols = "";
1143 | 
1144 | 	    if((sw_format & SW_LONG)
1145 | 		|| (char *) NULL == (release = strchr( module, '/')))
1146 | 		release = "";		/* no release info */
1147 | 	    else
1148 | 		*release++ = '\0';
1149 | 
1150 | 	    /**
1151 | 	     **  Long or short format
1152 | 	     **/
1153 | 
1154 | 	    if(sw_format & (SW_TERSE|SW_PARSE|SW_HUMAN)) {/** short format **/
1155 | 		int tmp_len;
1156 | 
1157 | 		if( sw_format & SW_PARSE ) {
1158 | 			sprintf( _file_list_buffer, short_format_full,
1159 | 				module, release, symbols);
1160 | 		} else {	/* assume a human readable format */
1161 | 			if (*symbols) {
1162 | 				sprintf( _file_list_buffer, short_format_full,
1163 | 					module, release, symbols);
1164 | 			} else {
1165 | 				if (*release) {
1166 | 					sprintf( _file_list_buffer,
1167 | 						short_format_part,
1168 | 						module, release);
1169 | 				} else {
1170 | 					sprintf( _file_list_buffer,
1171 | 						short_format, module);
1172 | 				}
1173 | 			}
1174 | 		}
1175 | 		_add_file_list( _file_list_buffer);
1176 | 	
1177 | 		tmp_len = strlen( _file_list_buffer);
1178 | 		if( tmp_len > maxlen) 
1179 | 		    maxlen = tmp_len;
1180 | 
1181 | 	    } else if ( sw_format & SW_LONG) {		/** long format **/
1182 | 
1183 | 		/**
1184 | 		 **  Get the time of last modification
1185 | 		 **/
1186 | 
1187 | 		if((struct tm *) NULL != (tm = gmtime( &stats.st_mtime))) {
1188 | 		    sprintf( buffer, "%04d/%02d/%02d %2d:%02d:%02d",
1189 | 			1900+tm->tm_year, tm->tm_mon + 1, tm->tm_mday,
1190 | 			tm->tm_hour, tm->tm_min, tm->tm_sec);
1191 | 		    timestr = buffer;
1192 | 
1193 | 		} else
1194 | 		    timestr = "";
1195 | 
1196 | 		/**
1197 | 		 **  Now print and free what we've allocated
1198 | 		 **/
1199 | 
1200 | 		fprintf( stderr, long_format, module, symbols,
1201 | 		    timestr);
1202 | 
1203 | 	    }
1204 | 
1205 | 	    null_free((void *) &module);
1206 | 
1207 | 	} /** if( !stat) **/
1208 | 
1209 | 	list++;
1210 | 
1211 |     } /** while **/
1212 | 
1213 |     /**
1214 |      **  In case of terse output we have to flush our buffer
1215 |      **/
1216 | 
1217 |     if( !(sw_format & SW_LONG) ) {
1218 | 	if( _file_list_wr_ndx > 0) 
1219 | 	    print_terse_files( terminal_width, maxlen, header, numbered);
1220 |     }
1221 | 
1222 |     if (! modpath) {
1223 | 	null_free((void *)&modpath);
1224 |     }
1225 | 
1226 | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
1227 |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_print_aligned_files, NULL);
1228 | #endif
1229 | 
1230 | } /** End of 'print_aligned_files' **/
1231 | 
1232 | /*++++
1233 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1234 |  ** 									     **
1235 |  **   Function:		print_terse_files				     **
1236 |  ** 									     **
1237 |  **   Description:	Print out the filenames in the _file_list array in   **
1238 |  **			case of terse output 				     **
1239 |  ** 									     **
1240 |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
1241 |  ** 									     **
1242 |  **   Parameters:	int	  terminal_width	Terminal size	     **
1243 |  **			int	  len			max. filename length **
1244 |  **			char	 *header		header to print	     **
1245 |  **			int	  number		value to start number**
1246 |  ** 							use -1 for none	     **
1247 |  ** 									     **
1248 |  **   Result:		-						     **
1249 |  ** 									     **
1250 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
1251 |  ** 									     **
1252 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1253 |  ++++*/
1254 | 
1255 | static	void	print_terse_files(  int terminal_width,
1256 | 				    int len,
1257 | 				    char *header,
1258 | 				    int numbered)
1259 | {
1260 |     char	*module;
1261 |     char	*moduleright;
1262 | 
1263 |     /**
1264 |      **  Print human readable lists
1265 |      **/
1266 | 
1267 |     len += (numbered != -1 ? 6 : 1);
1268 |     if( sw_format & SW_HUMAN ) {
1269 | 	int columns = (terminal_width - 1) / len;
1270 | 	int col_ndx, row_ndx;
1271 | 	int rows;
1272 |         int mod_ndx;
1273 |         
1274 | 	/**
1275 | 	 **  Print the header line
1276 | 	 **/
1277 | 
1278 | 	if( header) {
1279 | 	    int lin_len = terminal_width - strlen( header) - 2;
1280 | 	    int i;
1281 | 
1282 | 	    fprintf( stderr, "\n");
1283 | 
1284 | 	    if( lin_len >= 2) 
1285 | 		for( i = 0; i < lin_len / 2; i++)
1286 | 		    fprintf( stderr, "-");
1287 | 
1288 | 	    fprintf( stderr, " %s ", header);
1289 | 
1290 | 	    if( lin_len >= 2)
1291 | 		for( i = 0; i < (lin_len+1) / 2; i++)
1292 | 		    fprintf( stderr, "-");
1293 | 
1294 | 	    fprintf( stderr, "\n");
1295 | 	}
1296 | 
1297 | 	/**
1298 | 	 **  Print the columns
1299 | 	 **/
1300 | 
1301 |         
1302 | 	if( !columns)
1303 | 	    columns = 1;
1304 | 	rows = (_file_list_wr_ndx + columns - 1) / columns;
1305 | 
1306 |         for( row_ndx = 0; row_ndx < rows; row_ndx++) {
1307 |           for( col_ndx = 0; col_ndx < columns; col_ndx++) { 
1308 |             
1309 |             mod_ndx = row_ndx + col_ndx * rows;
1310 |             
1311 |             if( (module = _pick_file_list( mod_ndx)) ) {
1312 |               moduleright = _pick_file_list( row_ndx + (col_ndx+1)* rows);
1313 | 
1314 |               print_spaced_file( module, len,
1315 |                                  ( (col_ndx == columns - 1)
1316 |                                    || (moduleright == (char *) NULL)
1317 |                                    ? 0 : 1 ),
1318 |                                   ( (numbered == -1) ? numbered : ++mod_ndx) );
1319 | 		}
1320 | 	    }
1321 | 	    fprintf( stderr, "\n");
1322 | 	}
1323 |     }
1324 | 
1325 |     /**
1326 |      **  Print parseable lists
1327 |      **/
1328 | 
1329 |     else {
1330 | 	while( (module = _get_file_list()) ) {
1331 | 	    fprintf( stderr, "%s\n", module);
1332 | 	}
1333 |     }
1334 | }
1335 | 
1336 | /*++++
1337 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1338 |  ** 									     **
1339 |  **   Function:		_add_file_list   				     **
1340 |  **			_init_file_list					     **
1341 |  **			_get_file_list					     **
1342 |  **			_pick_file_list					     **
1343 |  ** 									     **
1344 |  **   Description:	File list functions for terse module display mode    **
1345 |  ** 									     **
1346 |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
1347 |  ** 									     **
1348 |  **   Parameters:	char	*name		Name to be stored	     **
1349 |  ** 									     **
1350 |  **   Result:		-						     **
1351 |  ** 									     **
1352 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
1353 |  ** 									     **
1354 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1355 |  ++++*/
1356 | 
1357 | static	void _init_file_list()
1358 | {
1359 |     if( _file_list_ptr && !_file_list_cnt) {
1360 | 	null_free((void *) &_file_list_ptr);
1361 | 	_file_list_cnt = 0;
1362 |     }
1363 | 
1364 |     _file_list_wr_ndx = 0;
1365 |     _file_list_rd_ndx = 0;
1366 | }
1367 | 
1368 | static	void _add_file_list( char *name)
1369 | {
1370 |     /**
1371 |      **  Parameter check
1372 |      **/
1373 | 
1374 |     if( !name || !*name)
1375 | 	return;
1376 | 
1377 |     /**
1378 |      **  Reallocate if the current array is to small
1379 |      **/
1380 | 
1381 |     if( _file_list_cnt <= _file_list_wr_ndx) {
1382 | 	_file_list_cnt += FILE_LIST_SEGM_SIZE;
1383 | 
1384 | 	if( !_file_list_ptr) 
1385 | 	    _file_list_ptr =
1386 | 		(char **) module_malloc(_file_list_cnt * sizeof(char *));
1387 | 	else
1388 | 	    _file_list_ptr = (char **) realloc( _file_list_ptr,
1389 | 		_file_list_cnt * sizeof(char *));
1390 | 
1391 |     }
1392 | 
1393 |     /**
1394 |      **  Save the passed name, if the allocation succeeded
1395 |      **/
1396 | 
1397 |     if( !_file_list_ptr) {
1398 | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1399 | 	_file_list_cnt = 0;
1400 | 	_file_list_wr_ndx = 0;
1401 | 	_file_list_rd_ndx = 0;
1402 | 
1403 |     } else {
1404 | 	_file_list_ptr[ _file_list_wr_ndx++] = stringer(NULL,0, name, NULL);
1405 |     }
1406 | }
1407 | 
1408 | static	char *_get_file_list()
1409 | {
1410 |     return((_file_list_rd_ndx < _file_list_wr_ndx) ?
1411 | 	 _file_list_ptr[ _file_list_rd_ndx++] : (char *) NULL);
1412 | }
1413 | 
1414 | static	char *_pick_file_list( int ndx)
1415 | {
1416 |     return((ndx < _file_list_wr_ndx) ? _file_list_ptr[ ndx] : (char *) NULL);
1417 | }
1418 | 
1419 | /*++++
1420 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1421 |  ** 									     **
1422 |  **   Function:		print_spaced_file				     **
1423 |  ** 									     **
1424 |  **   Description:	Print out the passed filename and fill the output    **
1425 |  **			area up to the passed number of characters	     **
1426 |  ** 									     **
1427 |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
1428 |  ** 									     **
1429 |  **   Parameters:	char	*name		Name to be printed	     **
1430 |  **			int	 maxwidth	With of the output field to  **
1431 |  **						be filled up		     **
1432 |  **			int	 space		Boolean value controlling if **
1433 |  **						the output area should be    **
1434 |  **						filled up with spaces or not **
1435 |  **			int	 number		value to start number list   **
1436 |  ** 						use -1 for none		     **
1437 |  ** 									     **
1438 |  **   Result:		-						     **
1439 |  ** 									     **
1440 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
1441 |  ** 									     **
1442 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1443 |  ++++*/
1444 | 
1445 | static	void print_spaced_file(	char	*name,
1446 | 				int	 maxwidth,
1447 | 				int	 space,
1448 | 				int	 number)
1449 | {
1450 |     int filelen;		/** Length of the filename to print	     **/
1451 | 
1452 | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
1453 |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_print_spaced_file, NULL);
1454 | #endif
1455 | 
1456 |     chk4spch( name);		/** turn any weird characters into ? marks   **/
1457 | 
1458 |     /**
1459 |      **  Print the name and calculate its length
1460 |      **/
1461 | 
1462 |     filelen = strlen( name);
1463 |     if( -1 != number) {
1464 | 	fprintf( stderr, "%3d) ", number);
1465 | 	filelen += 5;
1466 |     }
1467 | 
1468 |     fprintf(stderr, "%s",  name);
1469 | 
1470 |     /**
1471 |      **  Conditionally fill the output area with spaces
1472 |      **/
1473 | 
1474 |     if( space) {
1475 | 	putc(' ', stderr);
1476 | 	while( ++filelen < maxwidth)
1477 | 	    putc(' ', stderr);
1478 |     }
1479 | 
1480 | } /** end of 'print_spaced_file' **/
1481 | 
1482 | /*++++
1483 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1484 |  ** 									     **
1485 |  **   Function:		mkdirnm						     **
1486 |  ** 									     **
1487 |  **   Description:	Build a full pathname out of the passed directory    **
1488 |  **			and file					     **
1489 |  ** 									     **
1490 |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
1491 |  ** 									     **
1492 |  **   Parameters:	char	*dir		The directory to be used     **
1493 |  **			char	*file		The filename w/o path	     **
1494 |  ** 									     **
1495 |  **   Result:		char*	NULL		Compound filename to long    **
1496 |  **				else		Pointer to the full path     **
1497 |  ** 									     **
1498 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
1499 |  ** 									     **
1500 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1501 |  ++++*/
1502 | 
1503 | static	char *mkdirnm(	char	*dir,
1504 | 			char	*file)
1505 | {
1506 |     static char  dirbuf[ MOD_BUFSIZE];	/** Buffer for path creation	     **/
1507 | 
1508 | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
1509 |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_mkdirnm, ", dir='", dir, ", file='",
1510 | 	file, "'", NULL);
1511 | #endif
1512 | 
1513 |     /**
1514 |      **  If only a file is given, or the file is in the current directory
1515 |      **  return just the file.
1516 |      **/
1517 | 
1518 |     if( dir == NULL || *dir == '\0' || !strcmp(dir,"."))
1519 | 	return( strcpy( dirbuf, file));
1520 | 
1521 |     /**
1522 |      **  Check whether the full path fits into the buffer
1523 |      **/
1524 | 
1525 |     if( (int) ( strlen( dir) + 1 + strlen( file) + 1 ) > MOD_BUFSIZE) {
1526 | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_NAMETOLONG, LOC, dir, file, NULL))
1527 | 	    return( NULL);
1528 |     }
1529 | 
1530 |     /**
1531 |      **  Copy directory and file into the buffer taking care that there will
1532 |      **  be no double slash ...
1533 |      **/
1534 | 
1535 |     strcpy( dirbuf, dir);
1536 |     if( dir[ strlen( dir) - 1] != '/' && file[0] != '/')
1537 | 	strcat( dirbuf, "/");
1538 |     return( strcat( dirbuf, file));
1539 | 
1540 | } /** End of 'mkdirnm' **/
1541 | 
1542 | /*++++
1543 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1544 |  ** 									     **
1545 |  **   Function:		fi_ent_cmp					     **
1546 |  ** 									     **
1547 |  **   Description:	compares two file entry structures		     **
1548 |  **			Different cmdline arguments (i.e. -u, -c, -t, -z)    **
1549 |  **			will change what value is compared. As a default,    **
1550 |  **			the name is used.				     **
1551 |  **									     **
1552 |  **   Notes:		This procedure is used as comparison function for    **
1553 |  **			qsort()					 	     **
1554 |  ** 									     **
1555 |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
1556 |  ** 									     **
1557 |  **   Parameters:	const void *fi1		First file entry	     **
1558 |  **			const void *fi2		Second one to compare	     **
1559 |  ** 									     **
1560 |  **   Result:		int	1 	fi2 > fi1			     **
1561 |  **    				-1	fi2 < fi1			     **
1562 |  **	  			0	fi2 == fi1			     **
1563 |  ** 									     **
1564 |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
1565 |  ** 									     **
1566 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1567 |  ++++*/
1568 | 
1569 | static	int fi_ent_cmp(	const void	*fi1,
1570 | 			const void	*fi2)
1571 | {
1572 | 
1573 | #ifdef DEF_COLLATE_BY_NUMBER
1574 |   return colcomp( ((fi_ent*)fi1)->fi_name, ((fi_ent*)fi2)->fi_name);
1575 | #else
1576 |   return strcmp( ((fi_ent*)fi1)->fi_name, ((fi_ent*)fi2)->fi_name);
1577 | #endif
1578 | }
